summary: Their sharp disagreement about precedent reflects different worldviews that go far beyond abortion.. Hyatt, Justice Breyer added: "Today's decision can only cause one to wonder which cases the Court will overrule next."

title: Match Words With Actions in Venezuela, Mr. President
summary: Follow Reagan's example in rescuing Grenada from Cuban domination.. President Trump has stood firmly on the side of the Venezuelan people. title: The Dollar May Be Knocked off Its Pedestal

title: The 'Underpaid Teachers' Myth
summary: Applying the same method, telemarketers don't make enough and nurses are overpaid.. Are public-school teachers really underpaid? Yet the greatest threat to U.S. interests may come from President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's incompetent economic management.

title: The College-Admissions Mess
summary: The SAT's new index should be seen as a patch to liberalism's greatest failure.. The college-admissions bribery scandal was one of the most shocking and least surprising stories of the year. title: Democrats Say the Craziest Things

title: For Thrills, You Can't Beat Playoff Hockey
summary: The NHL is far less predictable than the other major sports.. The playoffs are always more exciting than the regular season. But baseball, football and basketball have nothing on hockey. You know what to expect in the other leagues: The New England Patriots have a good shot at going to the Super Bowl, and you'll be shocked if anyone beats the Golden State Warriors in the basketball finals.

title: 'Materials of the Mind' Review: The Lost Art of Reading Bumps
summary: Phrenology (n.): the study of the conformation of the skull based on the belief that it is indicative of mental faculties and character.. In the summer of 1868, in sweltering Barbados, a man named W.D. Maxwell, a native of the island, gave a series of public lectures on the subject of phrenology. Audience members were pleased; a Mr. Brewster, who had his head measured and manipulated by Maxwell, later professed his enthusiasm for the new science in a letter to the Barbados Times. Maxwell was on a roll: After a repeat performance in neighboring British Guyana, he eventually took his phrenology lectures to England, where his "piercing eye" (as the papers reported) came to rest on the skulls of compliant Brits. In his wide-ranging, engagingly written "Materials of the Mind," James Poskett, an assistant professor at the University of Warwick, reveals that Maxwell's career wasn't an anomaly. Phrenology wasn't just Western or limited to a particular country. From Cambridge, Mass., to Canberra, from Calcutta to Cape Colony, the world had gone cranium-crazy.

title: Susan Rice, Other Politicos Join Venture Firm Amplo

title: Cruise to Russia: An Easy, Affordable Way to Soak Up St. Petersburg
summary: For a quick, rather kitschy trip from Helsinki to St. Petersburg, board this basic overnight cruise. And bring your dancing shoes. THE OLDER Russian couple extended their arms over the ship's railing, pandering to the greedy seagulls that swooped over the glittering Baltic Sea by offering pieces of bread. Other passengers lingered on the deck to watch the passing sea as the ship chugged east from Helsinki toward St. Petersburg, but I went inside to escape the windy chill. I wandered past the duty-free shop, casino, "Night Funny Rabbit" lounge and a restaurant named "New York City" whose menu boasts steak, cheesecake and Ukrainian borscht. In the Columbus Bar, armchairs faced a wall of windows, the better to watch the sun sink into the horizon. A Russian band was firing up tunes on a keyboard and electric guitar and-as passengers filled the lounge and ordered beers, mojitos and mai tais-I wondered what the evening show would bring.

title: Three Puglia Properties for Your Next Italian Escape
summary: Fifteen years ago, it was deserted countryside. Now, thanks to an updated airport and better high-speed rail, Puglia is a gem that insiders love. Three places to try. THE SOUTHERN stretch of Italy's Puglia region, set between the Ionian and Adriatic seas, is spare but beautiful country that insiders love to keep to themselves. That's getting harder to do, however. "Fifteen years ago, it was tumbleweeds," says Irish designer Deborah Nolan, who owns Tulsishop, a series of boutiques in the area. "There were no foreign voices. The [local] airport was basically a shed." That airport, in Brindisi, was upgraded in 2018, and the fast train from Rome has now arrived. And yet, "there's still a stillness," Nolan notes. "Even as it gets busier, it's a certain interesting, conscious person who ends up here." And quietly stylish places to stay have started opening to meet the demand. Early this year, in the town of Nardò, French Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin and his TV-producer wife, Katherina Marx, debuted the 10-room Palazzi Maritati e Muci (above) in a pair of centuries-old frescoed structures, with a former Saint Laurent art director helping to place furnishings by Ico Parisi, Gio Ponti, Tobia Scarpa and others. This spring, the team behind Rome's G-Rough hotel opened Palazzo Daniele, reimagining an 1861 neoclassical house in Gagliano del Capo as a nine-suite, contemporary art-filled retreat. And slightly farther north, near Fasano, the 16th-century Masseria Torre Maizza is now in the hands of British-Italian hotelier Rocco Forte, whose nearly $7 million, eight-month-long redo of the 40-room resort was completed last month.

title: Wynn Resorts, MGM Resorts End Talks Over Boston-Area Casino

summary: Resume Subscription. When rapper will.i.am was looking for a hook to invigorate the Black Eyed Peas' 2018 single "Constant," he borrowed from an old favorite: 1985's "La Di Da Di" by Slick Rick and Doug E. Fresh. "I wanted to go back to the era that made me want to rap," will.i.am says.

summary: E-retail giant's investment in U.K.-based Deliveroo means more competitive spending likely on menu. Uber Technologies' ride could be getting even more costly.

title: Global Investors Get Burned on Their Favorite Chinese Surveillance Stock
summary: Would-be buyers of innovative Chinese technology companies have been too complacent about the risk of getting trapped between Beijing and Washington. Huawei may be privately owned, but global investors still risk getting caught up in the unfolding Sino-American spy thriller through other Chinese companies.

title: Imminent Vale Dam Disaster Bears Down on Brazilian Town

summary: The high school comedy aims to follow in the footsteps of 'American Graffiti,' 'Clueless' and 'Superbad' while taking teen tropes in new directions. Filmmakers can't resist visiting a daunting world where archetypes collide, emotions run high and even the smallest stakes feel huge.

title: High Water Levels on Great Lakes Flood Towns
summary: Lakes Erie, Superior are among Great Lakes expected to reach all-time highs this summer. Mike Snider says 10 floods have struck Port Clinton, Ohio, since he was appointed mayor April 9, as heavy rains, powerful winds and high water in Lake Erie slammed the city of 6,000.

title: Duterte Cements Power as Allies Sweep Senate in Philippine Vote
summary: The outcome allows the president to proceed with an agenda that includes restoring the death penalty. President Rodrigo Duterte's allies won almost every seat up for grabs in crucial Senate races in the Philippines' midterm elections, a victory for the popular president and the rightward, authoritarian turn in much of Southeast Asia that he represents.

title: Hong Kong Activist Granted Asylum by Germany: 'I Had No Choice'
summary: Ray Wong Toi Yeung fled Hong Kong ahead of his trial on charges of inciting to riot and illegal assembly. Germany has granted asylum to two Hong Kong pro-democracy protesters, a sign of waning international confidence in the city's political freedoms and justice system.

title: St. Louis Fed Chief Says Interest Rate May Be Cut to Meet Inflation Target
summary: James Bullard is first central-bank official in recent years to lay out case for lowering rate. Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard said Wednesday the U.S. central bank may need to lower its short-term interest-rate target if inflation doesn't appear on track to rise back to desired levels.

title: Saudi Arabia Strikes Deal to Buy U.S. Natural Gas
summary: Aramco signs initial agreement to purchase LNG from Sempra Energy, in new step for the kingdom. Saudi Arabia has set up a deal to purchase U.S. liquefied natural gas from Sempra Energy , a new strategic direction for the kingdom as it seeks to establish a footprint in the growing global market for the fuel.

title: Kentucky Gov. Matt Bevin to Face Andy Beshear in November Election
summary: GOP incumbent survives strong primary challenge; state attorney general is Democratic nominee. LOUISVILLE, Ky.-Kentucky Republican Gov. Matt Bevin cleared his first hurdle toward a second term but had to fend off a strong primary challenge Tuesday, setting up a long-anticipated showdown with his arch-nemesis-Democrat Andy Beshear-that will settle the feud they've fought in courtrooms over education and pension policies.

WASHINGTON-President Trump on Tuesday told Democratic congressional leaders that Congress should approve his trade deal with Canada and Mexico before taking up infrastructure legislation.

title: Indonesian President Re-Elected in Race Shaped by Conservative Islam
summary: President re-elected with 55.5% of the vote, defeating candidate supported by hard-line Islamic conservatives. JAKARTA, Indonesia-President Joko Widodo was comfortably re-elected the leader of the world's largest Muslim-majority nation, after tacking rightward to win over an electorate that has shown signs of embracing a more conservative form of the faith.

summary: Officer Daniel Pantaleo faces disciplinary charges over the 2014 death of Garner. New York Police Department officers involved in the arrest of Eric Garner attempted to calm him before applying force, according to testimony by the partner of Officer Daniel Pantaleo, who faces disciplinary charges over the 2014 death of Mr. Garner.

title: Non-Military Spending Is Sticking Point in Budget Talks
summary: Congressional leaders, Trump administration officials end initial negotiations without reaching deal that they had earlier suggested was within reach. WASHINGTON-Congressional leaders began negotiations with the White House over a two-year budget deal but hit a sticking point over Democrats' efforts to raise non-military spending.

title: Real-Estate Stocks in High Demand as Trade Battle Brews
summary: REITS offer investors exposure to businesses geared toward domestic market. Many investors are turning to real-estate stocks as a safe haven during the U.S.-China trade dispute that has been whipsawing the stock market.
